programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: No Loan Again, Naturally: When Homer and Marge's mortgage rate skyrockets, they have to put their house up for sale - and Flanders buys it and becomes their landlord. (S20 Ep12/21)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Indecision Amalgamation: Raj has a dating dilemma. Penny can't decide whether to accept a role in a terrible film. Sheldon chooses between two gaming systems. (S7 Ep19)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Relationship Diremption: Sheldon wonders whether he's wasting his time with his study of string theory. Raj and Emily go on a double date with Howard and Bernadette. (S7 Ep20)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Teen Angst and a Smart-Boy Walk of Shame: Sheldon confronts the failure of his database, Georgie and Mandy struggle as new parents, and Missy feels forgotten. (S6 Ep15)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Stolen Truck and Going on the Lam: Missy steals her dad's truck and hits the road with her friend Paige. (S6 Ep16)

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Brand new series: It's time for the Couples Retreat in Byron Bay. But one bride storms out, and one groom is left questioning who he can trust. (S12 Ep22)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Jerusalem Duality: Sheldon's confidence is shaken to the core by a 15-year-old physicist who is clearly much brighter than him. (S1 Ep12)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bat Jar Conjecture: Sheldon is ousted from the gang's Physics Bowl quiz team, so he decides to prove his superiority by forming his own team for the event. (S1 Ep13)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Nerdvana Annihilation: Penny makes fun of Leonard's habit of collecting goofy memorabilia, but his friends kick up a fuss and try to keep him on the side of the nerds. (S1 Ep14)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Strudel and a Hot American Boy Toy: Sheldon explores Germany behind Mary's back, Missy attempts to pull a fast one on George Sr, and Meemaw and Dale adjust. (S7 Ep3)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Ants on a Log and a Cheating Winker: Missy steps up, Mary has a surprise for George, and Sheldon finds his dorm occupied. (S7 Ep4)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Halloween: Claire, who loves Halloween, ropes in the whole family to spookify the Dunphy house, but none of it goes quite to plan. (S2 Ep6)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Chirp: Claire and Haley have a bit of quality girl time while they're stuck at home sick. Phil is preoccupied by the taunts of a chirping smoke detector. (S2 Ep7)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Coming to Homerica: When nearby Ogdenville's unemployed come to Springfield looking for jobs, Mayor Quimby shuts the town's borders and enlists private citizens to guard them. (S20 Ep21/21)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: You Only Move Twice: Homer is offered a new job by mysterious businessman Hank Scorpio. But will Marge, Bart and Lisa be happy in their idyllic new home town? (S8 Ep2/25)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Vartabedian Conundrum: Leonard goes to Penny for help when his relationship with Stephanie takes off faster than he'd like, but will he act on her advice? (S2 Ep10/23)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bath Item Gift Hypothesis: At Christmas, Leonard's hunky colleague starts dating Penny, while Sheldon's obsession with gift-giving etiquette torments everyone. (S2 Ep11)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Killer Robot Instability: Kripke challenges the boys to a robot duel, while Howard is devastated when Penny finally tells him what she thinks of his chauvinism. (S2 Ep12)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Secret War of Lisa Simpson: Bart and Lisa enrol in military school, but Lisa finds it hard to fit in. Guest starring Willem Dafoe. (S8 Ep25/25)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Grace gets a warning, but can Donny break through to Dillon? Meanwhile, a family reunion continues to grow, but at what cost?

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight...
programme.desc: ...Australia: Brand new series: The Couples Retreat takes a dramatic turn. A bride's behaviour causes a storm, and another bride reaches breaking point at the final night drinks. (S12 Ep23)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Andrea and her son Stephan roll up for an evening of double dating. And bagpipe instructor Adam is deflated by online dating; can he get back on song with fellow Scot Conor? (S21 Ep2)

programme.title: All The Goals: Giggs
programme.desc: Sit back, relax and enjoy every goal that Ryan Giggs scored for United, spanning his illustrious career at the club.

programme.title: PL: United v Man City 94/95
programme.desc: United Archives 10/11/94. A classic derby encounter as Brian Horton brought his team across the city to Old Trafford.

programme.title: PL: United v Ipswich 94/95
programme.desc: United Archives 4/3/95. An amazing goal-fest at the Theatre of Dreams in March 95 as Andy Cole scored five times in an historic 9-0 victory over Ipswich Town.

programme.title: PL: Bolton v United 95/96
programme.desc: United Archives 25/2/96. With a huge trip to Newcastle looming, United looked to keep the pressure on at the top by beating struggling Bolton.

programme.title: PL: United v Nottm Forest 95/96
programme.desc: United Archives 28/4/96. United ended their home campaign against Nottingham Forest, knowing that a win would take them to the brink of the Premiership title.

programme.title: PL: United v Sunderland 96/97
programme.desc: United Archives 21/12/96. United took on Sunderland for the first time in the Premier League on what was to be a memorable afternoon at the Theatre of Dreams.

programme.title: PL: Nottm Forest v United 98/99
programme.desc: United Archives 6/2/99. Former United boss Ron Atkinson was hoping to get one over his old club when they visited the City Ground with Forest deep in relegation trouble.

programme.title: PL: United v Bradford 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 5/9/00. United battered the Bantams in impressive style with Teddy Sheringham and Quinton Fortune hitting a brace each.

programme.title: PL: United v Southampton 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 28/10/00. United welcomed struggling Southampton looking to keep up their scintillating home form, having scored 22 goals in their opening six league contests at the Theatre of Dreams.

programme.title: PL: United v Arsenal 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 25/2/01. United welcomed Arsenal knowing that victory would move them closer to securing a third consecutive Premiership crown.

programme.title: PL: United v Derby 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 12/12/2001. After 3 Successive League defeats, United hoped to rediscover their form at home to Derby.

programme.title: PL United v Southampton 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 22/12/01. Sir Alex's side took on Southampton with the visitors looking for their first win at Old Trafford since January 1988.

programme.title: PL: United v Blackburn 10/11
programme.desc: United Archives 27/11/10. The Reds looked to make it 20 Premier League games unbeaten as they welcomed Big Sam's Blackburn to Old Trafford.

programme.title: Phallon Tullis-Joyce: Season Review
programme.desc: Phallon Tullis-Joyce looks back at some of her best saves from the season so far.

programme.title: PL: United v Newcastle 07/08
programme.desc: United Archives 12/1/08. An uneventful first half is quickly forgotten about when United put Newcastle to the sword in the final 45.

programme.title: PL: United v Arsenal 11/12
programme.desc: United Archives 28/8/11. The Reds welcomed an Arsenal side who had made a slow start to the season. With the Gunners hampered by injuries and suspensions, could Sir Alex's men take advantage?

programme.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock
programme.desc: 1975. Drama. Directed by Peter Weir. Stars Rachel Roberts, Anne-Louise Lambert & Vivean Gray. A school summer picnic takes an unpleasant turn when a group of students and a teacher vanish. [S]

programme.title: The Fourth War
programme.desc: 1990. Drama. Directed by John Frankenheimer. Stars Roy Scheider, Jürgen Prochnow & Tim Reid. On the Russian border, the murder of a defector sparks a forbidden battle between two colonels. [S]

programme.title: Three Came Home
programme.desc: 1950. True story of a woman imprisoned in several Japanese war camps. She struggles to protect her young son. Stars Claudette Colbert.

programme.title: Colonel March of Scotland Yard
programme.desc: The Case of the Kidnapped Poodle. 1956. Stars Boris Karloff, Ewan Roberts. Colonel March investigates the theft of a valuable diamond and the kidnapping of a poodle. [S]

programme.title: Dangerous Assignment
programme.desc: The Archaeological Story. 1952. Stars Brian Donlevy, Randy Stuart & Lyle Talbot. Steve travels to the Trans-Jordan area to find a missing goddess statuette and protect her from the wrong hands. [S]

programme.title: Come Back Peter
programme.desc: 1952. Comedy. Director: Charles Saunders. Stars Patrick Holt, Peter Hammond, Humphrey Lestocq & Kathleen Boutall. Pandemonium is created in a home when various relatives come to stay. [S]

programme.title: Clash By Night
programme.desc: 1963. Drama. Directed by Montgomery Tully. Starring Terence Longdon, Jennifer Jayne & Harry Fowler. A prison bus enroute to jail is hijacked by a gang determined to free their leader. [S]

programme.title: Mohawk
programme.desc: 1956. Adventure. Director: Kurt Neumann. Stars Scott Brady, Rita Gam & Neville Brand. An artist is torn between his love for two women and is thrown into the middle of a Mohawk-Iroquois-American. [S]

programme.title: The 20 Questions Murder Mystery
programme.desc: 1950. Crime. Director: Paul L. Stein. Stars Robert Beatty, Rona Anderson & Clifford Evans. Prior to committing a crime, someone sends in a question to the B.B.C.'s '20 Questions' programme. [S]

programme.title: The Strange Love of Martha Ivers
programme.desc: 1946. Drama. Director: Lewis Milestone. Stars Barbara Stanwyck, Van Heflin, Lizabeth Scott & Kirk Douglas. The relationships formed in childhood by three friends lead to murder and obsessive love. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life East of Suez
programme.desc: 1966. An intriguing look at how British troops are policing the rivers and jungles of Borneo and a glimpse of some of the problems that have to be overcome.

programme.title: The Small Voice
programme.desc: 1948. Drama. Director: Fergus McDonell. Stars. James Donald, Valerie Hobson, David Greene, Howard Keel. A couple come across a car crash, where they discover that the occupants are armed. [S]

programme.title: Mr. Beamish Goes South
programme.desc: 1953. Mystery. Directed by Oscar Burn & John Wall. Stars John Laurie & Hector Ross. An amateur detective pursues a seaside serial killer who disposes of his female victims in an acid bath. [S]

programme.title: The Edgar Wallace Mystery Theatre
programme.desc: Flat Two. 1961. Directed by Alan Cooke. Stars John Le Mesurier, Jack Watling & Barry Keegan. Two men visit the apartment of a rich gambler - Each with a strong motive for murder! [S]

programme.title: Colonel March of Scotland Yard
programme.desc: Death in the Dressing Room. 1956. Stars Boris Karloff, Ewan Roberts. A call for help during a Javanese dance is the clue that Colonel March needs to prove a faulty alibi. [S]

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: Hot Off the Griddle. 1966. Stars Adam West & Julie Newmar. The thefts of a department store catalogue, a catamaran, and three mittens, alerts Batman and Robin that Catwoman is loose again. [S]

programme.title: Dial 999
programme.desc: Robbery With Violence. 1958. Stars Robert Beatty, Robert Rietty & Therese Burton. Maguire struggles to find leads when investigating an armed raid on a pawn-shop where a passer-by was killed. [S]

programme.title: Rumpole of the Bailey
programme.desc: Rumpole and the Eternal Triangle. Stars: Leo McKern, Marion Mathie, Peter Blythe. Rumpole finds himself defending a husband on a charge for murder.

programme.title: Love for Lydia
programme.desc: Episode 9. 1977. Stars Mel Martin, Sherrie Hewson & Christopher Hancock. A devastated Richardson is revived by hard work and companionship at Tom's farm. Lydia redirects her attention elsewhere. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Caroline Munro returns with more extraordinary films to enjoy. First up, is John Carpenter's 1988 sci-fi horror They Live, based on the 1963 short story Eight O'Clock in the Morning. [S]

programme.title: They Live
programme.desc: 1988. Sci-fi Horror. Directed by John Carpenter. Stars Roddy Piper, Keith David & Meg Foster. A homeless drifter discovers a pair of sunglasses capable of showing the world the way it truly is. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Caroline continues the evening with more horror, as she introduces Don't Look in the Basement. Also known as The Forgotten, this 1973 independent film stars Bill McGhee and Rosie Holotik. [S]

programme.title: Don't Look In The Basement
programme.desc: 1973. Horror. Directed by S. F. Brownrigg and starring Bill McGhee, Jesse Lee Fulton and Robert Dracup. A young nurse goes to work in an asylum. There follows a murder - will she be next? [S]

programme.title: Don't Look In The Basement
programme.desc: 1973. Horror. Directed by S. F. Brownrigg and starring Bill McGhee, Jesse Lee Fulton and Robert Dracup. A young nurse goes to work in an asylum. There follows a murder - will she be next? [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: After a thrilling and frightful night, Caroline Munro is ready to close the doors of The Cellar Club, but not before allowing a peek at next weeks marvellous films. [S]

programme.title: Malice
programme.desc: 1993. Thriller. Director: Harold Becker. Stars Alec Baldwin, Nicole Kidman & Bill Pullman. The life of a married couple is severely disrupted after an enigmatic surgeon is invited into their home. [S]

programme.title: The Turners of Prospect Road
programme.desc: 1947. Comedy. Directed by Maurice J. Wilson. Stars: Wilfrid Lawson, Helena Pickard, Maureen Glynne. An abandoned greyhound puppy is trained to race after being found by a taxi driver. [S]

programme.title: The Beverly Hillbillies
programme.desc: The Great Feud. 1962. Stars Buddy Ebsen, Donna Douglas & Raymond Bailey. The Clampett clan takes great offense when Sonny jilts Elly, and they start a feud with the Drysdales. [S]

programme.title: Amos Burke: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Terror in a Tiny Town: Part 1. When Burke investigates the strange death of an atomic plant security officer, he finds a town in which the residents respond in robotic ways.

programme.title: What a Whopper
programme.desc: 1960. Comedy. What a Whopper is a comedy from former documentarist Gilbert Gunn. Adam Faith stars in this tale about a struggling writer who fakes photographs of the Loch Ness monster. [S]

programme.title: Dangerous Cargo
programme.desc: 1954. Drama directed by John Harlow. Tim (Jack Watling) is tricked by a wartime friend (Terence Alexander) into revealing details of a gold shipment. [S]

programme.title: Tonight in Great Britain
programme.desc: 1955. A star studded short film featuring Tessie O'Shea, Eddie Gray and Max Bygraves at the London Palladium, Hattie Jacques at the Players' Theatre, Jean Carson at the Café de Paris and many more!

programme.title: Now Barabbas Was a Robber
programme.desc: 1949. Drama. Directed by Gordon Parry. Stars Richard Greene, Cedric Hardwicke & Kathleen Harrison. Prison drama about a variety of criminals and their life behind bars in post-war Britain. [S]

programme.title: Train of Events
programme.desc: 1949. Drama. Directed by Sidney Cole, Charles Crichton and Basil Dearden. Starring Jack Warner, Susan Shaw and Gladys Henson. A train disaster is told as four short stories. [S]

programme.title: The Brothers
programme.desc: Partings. 1974. Stars Jean Anderson, Margaret Ashcroft & Jennifer Wilson. Edward and Brian meet with a merchant banker about Hammonds going public. Meanwhile, Gwen settles in as Mary's companion. [S]

programme.title: Kentucky Rifle
programme.desc: 1955. Western. Directed by Carl K. Hittleman. Stars Chill Wills & Lance Fuller. While escorting a wagon of rifles, a cowboy must find a way to outsmart the Comanche Indians who plan to steal them. [S]

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: The Sheriff of Boot Hill. 1959. Stars Rory Calhoun, Reed Hadley, Denver Pyle. A reluctant Bill accepts a job to become his old friend's deputy, even though several deputies before him were killed. [S]

programme.title: Booby Trap
programme.desc: 1957. Drama. An absent-minded professor invents a pen that will explode on the sound of bells... then leaves it in a taxi. Starring Sydney Tafler and Harry Fowler. [S]

programme.title: A Symphony Of London
programme.desc: A portrait of London life in the late 30s. Insight into travel, trade and traffic with some great scenes of Covent Garden and Piccadilly. All interwoven with a love story between two little dogs.

programme.title: Z-Cars
programme.desc: Manslaughter. 1976. Stars Allan O'Keefe & Jeffrey Kissoon. The public expect to be protected by the police. But if a policeman kills a member of the public, will the protector be protected? [S]

programme.title: Manhunt
programme.desc: The Death-Wish. 1970. Stars Peter Barkworth, Philip Madoc & James Maxwell. In Paris, Vincent is offered his freedom but is pressured to give up his friends. How can he be sure it is not a trap? [S]

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Mrs. Four and her Children. 1999. Stars Bruno Cremer, Marianne Basler & Christian Morin. Maigret investigates a chemist's wife who accused her husband of murder and claimed to have seen a corpse. [S]

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The Crime at Lock 14. 1963. Stars Rupert Davies, Hugh Burden & Isa Miranda. A yacht and a barge meet in the traffic of the canals, with their passing resulting in murder. [S]

programme.title: Fools Rush In
programme.desc: 1955. Drama. Director: Victor H. Komow. Stars Frank Silvera, Ken Buckridge & Jean Alexander. A ship with a cargo full of diamonds gets taken over by pirates. [S]

programme.title: Mademoiselle
programme.desc: 1966. Drama. Directed by Tony Richardson. Stars Jeanne Moreau, Ettore Manni & Keith Skinner. A schoolteacher channels her repressed passion into secret acts of violence and destruction. [S]
